meanings.definition: The state or quality of being nervous or easily startled.
meanings.sent1: Her jumpiness was evident as she constantly looked over her shoulder.
meanings.sent2: The sudden noise caused a wave of jumpiness among the group.
meanings.sent3: His jumpiness around spiders always made his friends chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The jumpiness in the air was palpable, signaling an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The jumpiness of the small dog made it clear it was not a fan of thunderstorms.

meanings.definition: A tendency to react quickly or impulsively.
meanings.sent1: His jumpiness often led him to make hasty decisions.
meanings.sent2: The driver's jumpiness caused him to hit the brakes suddenly.
meanings.sent3: The jumpiness of the squirrel made it dart across the road unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The jumpiness of the stock market kept investors on edge.
meanings.sent5: The jumpiness of the child made it challenging to keep up with his energy.

meanings.definition: A feeling of restlessness or agitation.
meanings.sent1: The jumpiness in her demeanor indicated she needed to take a break.
meanings.sent2: The jumpiness in the room suggested something exciting was about to happen.
meanings.sent3: His jumpiness during the meeting made it hard for others to focus.
meanings.sent4: The jumpiness of the waves hinted at an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The jumpiness of the cat hinted at its desire to play.
